name: [OHSU PROD] Postgres Server Down- country:{{host.country}} and facility:{{host.facility}} | POSTGRESQL_SERVER_DOWN: on cluster {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem:
Postgres server on cluster {{host.name}}  has not been responding  for the past 1m.

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps
1. Please check the Kibana logs for postgres server pod.
2. Please describe the postgres pod.
3. Exec to postgres pod and check why it is down

{{/is_alert}}

Notify @76358f8c.gecompany.onmicrosoft.com@amer.teams.ms @salil.sanghvi@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD] Scylla Nodetool Status  - country:{{host.country}} and facility:{{host.facility}} | SCYLLA_NODETOOL_STATUS_VM :  on cluster {{host.name}}
[OHSU PROD] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_NOT_REACHABLE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Application {{app.name}} is not reachable from cockpit system. 

Reason:
1. Application server might be down
2. Application url is wrong
3. Network connectivity issue.

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
1. Check whether application URL is correct and launch the web browser. In the address line, enter the web URL of the application.
2. If application doesn't come up in the browser, check application service status. If it's down, bring it up and try step 1 again.
3. For network connectivity issue, contact hospital IT team.

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}}
 @mural_service@ge.com @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | CM_SERVICE_UNREACHABLE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}}

Problem: 
CM cockpit application was not able to communicate with remote CM API service running on EHL.

Reason: 
1. User credentials are wrong or user doesn't exist in EHL WSO2. (Username is case-sensitive).
2. CM API service is down.
3. Network connectivity issue.

Resolution: 
1. Username is case-sensitive. If user does exists in EHL WSO2, give the same username while login into Mural CM.
2. If CM API service is down, start the service on EHL.
3. Check network connectivity.

If Issue not resolved: 
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and share with L4 team.

{{/is_alert}} @76358f8c.gecompany.onmicrosoft.com@amer.teams.ms @mural_service@ge.com @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD]: ETL job of Mural Insights failed on {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} To debug and fix follow the steps:
1. Login to the Tableau VM {{host.name}}
2. View the ETL job logs by opening the file "/var/spool/mail/dataupload" in a "vi" or any other editor.
3. Scroll to the end of the file and see the error. Reach out to engineering for any information
{{/is_alert}}  @salil.sanghvi@ge.com @jason.jiggins@med.ge.com @amy.konecny@ge.com @apriladkins@ge.com @christopher.j.mullins@ge.com, , @GE.Mural.support@ge.com                   @pagerduty-Mural

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_LOGIN_FAILED: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Application {{app.name}} failed to authenticate user credentials.

Reason:
User is not allowed to access {{app.name}} 

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
Check whether the user is created in the hospital LDAP. If user does not exist, contact the hospital IT team to create the user with proper credentials

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and contact L4.

{{/is_alert}}  @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: Datadog  Notification - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_LOGIN_PROCESSING_ERROR on cockpit system {{host.name}}
[OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_NOT_REACHABLE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Application {{app.name}} is not reachable from cockpit system. 

Reason:
1. Application server might be down
2. Application url is wrong
3. Network connectivity issue.

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
1. Check whether application URL is correct and launch the web browser. In the address line, enter the web URL of the application.
2. If application doesn't come up in the browser, check application service status. If it's down, bring it up and try step 1 again.
3. For network connectivity issue, contact hospital IT team.

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}}
 @mural_service@ge.com @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | CM_CRASHED: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}}

Problem: 
CM application crashed due to unknown runtime  error.

Reason: 
CM internal server was crashed due to unknown error. 

Resolution: 
Restart Mural application.

If Issue not resolved: 
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}} @mural_service@ge.com @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | CM_SERVICE_UNREACHABLE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}}

Problem: 
CM cockpit application was not able to communicate with remote CM API service running on EHL.

Reason: 
1. User credentials are wrong or user doesn't exist in EHL WSO2. (Username is case-sensitive).
2. CM API service is down.
3. Network connectivity issue.

Resolution: 
1. Username is case-sensitive. If user does exists in EHL WSO2, give the same username while login into Mural CM.
2. If CM API service is down, start the service on EHL.
3. Check network connectivity.

If Issue not resolved: 
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and share with L4 team.

{{/is_alert}} @mural_service@ge.com @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | COCKPIT_CPU_OVERLOADED: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}}

Problem: 
Mural CM cockpit system CPU is overloaded with more than 90% in use. It will impact the user experience on this system.

Reason: 
1. There might be other applications are running on cockpit system which were consuming more CPU.
2. Microsoft Windows update is pending or update was being installed in background.
3. Anti-virus software might consume more CPU.
4. System hard disk is full or there are a lot of temp files located at temp folder.

Resolution: 
Contact the hospital IT team to investigate the root cause. Ask them to clear temp folder.

If Issue not resolved: Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}}
 @mural_support@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_PATIENT_DEMOGRAPHIC_MISMATCH: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Patient demographics (i.e. Given Name, Family Name or Gender) in {{app.name}} were different from Surveillance Application.

Reason:
Due to a recent update and/or a manual entry, the demographic information displayed in the integrated applications might mismatch with the demographic information of the Population Surveillance View application system.

Resolution:
1. Check if application is getting latest feed and receiving it from the same ADT source .


If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}}  @mural_engineering@ge.com @mural_service@ge.com

name: Datadog Notification - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | COCKPIT_HARDDISK_OVERLOADED: on cockpit system {{host.name}} Status
message:
{{#is_alert}}

Problem: 
Mural CM cockpit system hard disk is overloaded with more than 90% in use. It will impact the user experience on this system.

Reason: 
1. System hard disk is full or there are a lot of temp files located at temp folder.
2. System disk is occupied by other files.

Resolution: 
Contact the hospital IT team to investigate the root cause. Ask them to clear temp folder and remove unnecessary files from cockpit system.

If Issue not resolved: Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4 team.

{{/is_alert}}
 @pradeep.harrymichael@ge.com @dhaval.manvar@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | PATIENT_NOT_FOUND: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Patient record doesn't exists in Application {{app.name}}.

Reason:
Application might not getting ADT feed from source.

Resolution:
1. Check if application is getting latest feed and receiving it from the same ADT source .

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | PATIENT_PROCESSING_ERROR: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Problem: 
Application {{app.name}} couldn't process patient context from Mural CM.

Reason:
Due to application slowness, it is not responding to Mural CM within a configured amount of time.

Resolution:
1. Increase application load timeout value in context manager configuration using CM config app . 

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and shared with L4.

{{/is_alert}}
 @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | APP_LAUNCH_PERFORMANCE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 
Problem: 
Integrated application in Mural CM took long time to launch.

Reason:
Application took {{optime.name}}  seconds to launch.
1. Application service might be slower.
2. Network connectivity issue or bandwidth might be low.
3. Cockpit system might be slow.

CM Serial No: {{srn.name}}
Application Name: {{app.name}}
Timestamp: {{timestamp.name}}

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
1. Check network connectivity and bandwidth in Cockpit system.
2. Check the performance of the {{app.name}} services. Contact to application team if the underlying services are slow. 
check for MS windows update or stop applications which are taking more CPU or/and Memory.
3. Check the performance of Cockpit system. If system is bit slow, check for MS windows update or stop applications which are taking more CPU or/and Memory.

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and contact L4.

{{/is_alert}}  @mural_engineering@ge.com @mural_service@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | CM_LAUNCH_PERFORMANCE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 
Problem: 
Mural CM application took more time to launch and display login screen window.

Reason:
CM application took {{optime.name}}  seconds to launch and display login screen window.
1. Cockpit system might be slow.

CM Serial No: {{srn.name}}
Timestamp: {{timestamp.name}}

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
Check the performance of Cockpit system. If system is bit slow, check for MS windows update or stop applications which are taking more CPU or/and Memory.

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and contact L4.

{{/is_alert}}  @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD DEBUG] - Mural CM - country:{{country.name}} and facility:{{facility.name}} | CM_LOGIN_PERFORMANCE: on cockpit system {{host.name}}
message:
{{#is_alert}} 
Problem: 
Mural CM application took more time to authenticate user and show main display.

Reason:
CM application took {{optime.name}}  seconds to authenticate user and display main screen window. Possible reasons could be:
1. Decisio application took long time to authenticate user.
2. Cockpit system might be slow.

CM Serial No: {{srn.name}}
Timestamp: {{timestamp.name}}

Resolution:
To fix this issue follow these steps:
Check the performance of Decisio application and Cockpit system. 

If Issue not resolved:
Collect logs from Mural Cockpit System located at < Mural Installation Directory>/MURAL_HOME/logs/ and contact L4.

{{/is_alert}}  @mural_engineering@ge.com

name: [OHSU PROD] Application Certificate Expiry Alert ohsu_prod
message:
This alert is triggered because the application URL is about to expire in next 30 days, please contact Mural Cloud Team to renew the certificates.
1. Create ServiceNow Ticket to renew the certificate or dial toll free number of GEHC NoC team
2. Assign it to Mural Cloud team
3. Certificates will be renewed by NoC team
4. Certificates have to be stored in Mural KeyVault
5. Renewed certificates will be applied on the Application Gateway by Mural Cloud Team
@mural_sre@ge.com @249bcb59.gecompany.onmicrosoft.com@amer.teams.ms @GE.Mural.support@ge.com
